steps.title: Drowning dreams can represent overwhelming stress and emotions.
steps.content: Drowning dreams can represent overwhelming stress and emotions. Getting pulled underwater might symbolize situations and emotions that are leaving you struggling to stay afloat in real life. These dreams can mean: You feel stressed and anxious. You’re dealing with overwhelming emotions. You feel out of control or powerless. You’re repressing your emotions. You’re dealing with unresolved trauma. You’re going through a rebirth or transformation.

Saving someone or something from drowning. Rescuing a friend, partner, coworker, or pet from drowning might represent something you want to save. This can be a sign that the thing you want to save isn’t taking priority right now. [1] X Research source For instance, a dream about rescuing your partner can mean other responsibilities are getting in the way of your relationship time. Take this dream as a sign to sort out your life and reflect on your priorities. Create an agenda each day to fit in the things that are important to you. Watching someone drown. Standing by while someone drowns can symbolize people and situations that are out of your control. This might be stressing you out, so take this dream as a sign to solve the issue and practice self-care . [2] X Research source Getting saved from drowning. Someone helping you out of the water at the last second might be a reminder to ask people for help . Instead of drowning in job or relationship stress, go to your friends and family for their guidance and support. Drowning but surviving. While this dream can feel scary, it’s considered a positive omen of resilience. Holding your own in the water might mirror your ability to overcome challenges in your personal and professional life. [3] X Research source When a challenge is on the horizon, build up your self-confidence to face it head on. List out your best qualities and take pride in your accomplishments. [4] X Trustworthy Source National Health Service (UK) Public healthcare system of the UK Go to source Drowning in a car. In the world of dreams, cars are thought to represent your direction in life. So, losing control of the vehicle and crashing into the water might indicate that your life isn’t going to plan or you’re not achieving your goals. [5] X Research source Interpret this dream as a sign to set more realistic goals and get your life on track. Separate a big goal into smaller tasks and set a deadline for each one. Drowning in a hurricane, tsunami, or flood. Getting washed away by a natural disaster can symbolize fear of the unknown. A change might be looming in the future which is leaving you feeling anxious. This dream might be a sign to accept change . Recognize that it’s an inevitable part of life that helps you grow. [6] X Research source Drowning in blood. Dreaming of struggling to tread water in blood might represent physical and emotional wounds. This can mean you’re healing, but you’re still dealing with some pain. Whether the wound is mental or physical, take this as a sign to deal with your hurt. You might prioritize relaxation or confront someone about how you feel.

Stress. Dreams are believed to help you process memories and emotions from your daily life. [7] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source So, the panic you feel about drowning in your dream might point to stressors at work, home, or in your relationships. If you’re feeling overwhelmed, this dream might be a sign to relieve your stress . Calm down your body by exercising, meditating, or doing something you love. Overwhelming emotions. Water can represent emotions in your dreams. If the water overtakes you and you’re struggling to breathe, this might symbolize fear, anger, guilt, or sadness that is overpowering you in real life. Take this dream as a sign to deal with your emotions . Name the emotion you feel and then ground yourself by breathing deeply . [8] X Research source Lack of control. Getting trapped under water can reflect situations in your personal or professional life that make you feel powerless. For instance, you might feel unable to meet deadlines at work or patch up a fight with a friend. Interpret this dream as a sign to face the problems that are overwhelming you. Just break the issue down into smaller problems so it feels easier to solve. Repressed emotions. Getting pulled down into the water might mirror hidden feelings that are resurfacing in your real life. Your subconscious might be telling you to deal with your emotions instead of pushing them away. Take this dream as a sign to express your feelings . Talking to friends or journaling your thoughts can help you process your emotions and feel lighter. [9] X Research source Unresolved trauma. If you’re having recurring drowning dreams, this might be a way for your subconscious to process a traumatic experience. Whether this is related to a near-drowning or something else, take this as a sign to meet with a therapist who can help you overcome your trauma . [10] X Research source If you’re not comfortable talking to a therapist, talk to people who you trust, like your friends, family, or religious leader. Or, join a support group. To cope with your trauma, practice mindfulness , hang out with friends, get 8 hours of rest, and exercise. [11] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Rebirth. Feeling at peace as you drown can be a positive sign of change. This might mean that you’re ready to let go of things that are holding you back and start a new chapter of life. [12] X Research source For instance, you might quit an unfulfilling job, end a toxic relationship, or get rid of negative thoughts . This dream can also be a sign to get out of your comfort zone and change your life for the better. Water is related to spiritual cleansing, so this dream is believed to signify spiritual growth, too.

steps.title: Relieve stress and work through emotions to resolve these dreams.
steps.content: Relieve stress and work through emotions to resolve these dreams. Recurring drowning dreams might be related to anxiety or trauma you’re experiencing. If you’re losing sleep, take steps to deal with these issues: talk to a therapist or trusted friend, express yourself, and prioritize your health. [13] X Trustworthy Source HelpGuide Nonprofit organization dedicated to providing free, evidence-based mental health and wellness resources. Go to source Interpreting your dreams can also help you identify related issues, work on the problem, and stop the dreams. [14] X Research source When you wake up, write down how you felt, what you were doing, and who you were with. Then, search for a link between your dream and what’s going on in your life.
